externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's IoT Edge Connect API

info.description: Process and deliver data for connected IoT devices in real time.
info.title: Akamai: IoT Edge Connect API

post.description: This operation globally reserves a namespace.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Edge Connect API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: The reservation JSON object specifies the namespace that is queued up for reservation in IoT Edge Connect.

namespace.description: The unique name of a namespace. This name must be between 2 and 40 characters. You can only use alphanumeric characters and underscores.

schema.description: Specifies an error response returned by the IoT Edge Connect API.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem. Consumers should not parse the `detail` member for information; extensions are more suitable and less error-prone ways to obtain such information.
detail.example: There must be at least 8 characters in a password, only 3 were provided.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. This field exists if there are many problems with a single request and you want to call them each out explicitly.

instance.description: The URI for this error occurrence. If a URL, it must be dereferenceable.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server. Used primarily when it may be changed, such as by an intermediary or cache.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: The URI for the error type. If a URL, it must be dereferenceable.

get.description: This operation lists all namespaces reserved for the account of the user making the request, up to 100 namespaces on a page.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Edge Connect API

parameters.description: The number of namespaces per page.
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: The number of the page with the number of namespaces to list specified in `size`. Page numbers start at zero.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: A list of comma-delimited hostnames that you want to retrieve reserved namespaces for. These hostnames may be associated with multiple properties within your account.
parameters.name: hostnames

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Specifies the user's reserved namespaces.

items.description: The reservation JSON object specifies the reserved namespace.

namespace.description: The name of a reserved namespace.

owner.description: The owner of a namespace reservation.

accountId.description: The account ID of the user who reserved this namespace.

createdBy.description: The name of the user who reserved this namespace.

reserved.description: The date of a namespace reservation.

200.description: A list of all reserved namespaces.

get.description: This operation lists up to 30 namespaces reserved for the account of the user making the request unless additional filtering parameters are specified.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Edge Connect API

parameters.description: Whether to search for reserved namespaces in all accounts or in the user's account only.
parameters.name: global

parameters.description: A search of string matching content. You can use the wildcard character `*` to search for unspecified content.
parameters.name: match

parameters.description: Whether to show connection details for the namespaces in the user's account.
parameters.name: detail

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Specifies the user's reserved namespaces.

items.description: The reservation JSON object specifies the reserved namespace.

namespace.description: The name of a reserved namespace.

owner.description: The owner of a namespace reservation.

accountId.description: The account ID of the user who reserved this namespace.

createdBy.description: The name of the user who reserved this namespace.

reserved.description: The date of a namespace reservation.

delete.description: This operation removes a previously reserved namespace. To remove a namespace, [delete](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/delete-configuration) all configurations of this namespace across jurisdictions.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Edge Connect API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Specifies an error response returned by the IoT Edge Connect API.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem. Consumers should not parse the `detail` member for information; extensions are more suitable and less error-prone ways to obtain such information.
detail.example: There must be at least 8 characters in a password, only 3 were provided.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. This field exists if there are many problems with a single request and you want to call them each out explicitly.

instance.description: The URI for this error occurrence. If a URL, it must be dereferenceable.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server. Used primarily when it may be changed, such as by an intermediary or cache.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: The URI for the error type. If a URL, it must be dereferenceable.

403.description: Access denied, the user has no right to perform the operation, or the affected resource belongs to a different customer or account.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem. Consumers should not parse the `detail` member for information; extensions are more suitable and less error-prone ways to obtain such information.
detail.example: There must be at least 8 characters in a password, only 3 were provided.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. This field exists if there are many problems with a single request and you want to call them each out explicitly.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server. Used primarily when it may be changed, such as by an intermediary or cache.

409.description: The namespace needs to be deprovisioned first.

parameters.description: The name of a namespace.
parameters.name: namespace

post.description: This operation creates a configuration for the namespace that you specified in the URL of the request and the jurisdiction that you specified in the body of the request. For ACL configuration guidelines, see [access control lists](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/access-control-lists) and [identity topic filters guidelines](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/identity-topic-filters-guidelines).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Edge Connect API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: The configuration JSON object specifies the configuration that you want to create for the specified namespace and jurisdiction.

acls.description: A list of access control rules for the configuration. Indicates users or clients that can publish or subscribe to specified topics. See [access control lists](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/access-control-lists).

publishers.description: A list of authorization group names. Indicates users or clients that have permission to publish messages to the topic referenced in `topicFilter`. With identity topic filters, use `*` to match a client or user identifier. See [authorization group wildcard](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/authorization-group-wildcard).

subscribers.description: A list of authorization group names. Indicates users or clients that have permission to subscribe to the topic referenced in `topicFilter`. With identity topic filters, use `*` to match a client or user identifier. See [authorization group wildcard](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/authorization-group-wildcard).

topicFilter.description: The path to the topic that you want to authorize `publishers` and `subscribers` to. It is either an absolute path or a wildcarded path. In wildcarded topic filters, use `+` to match a single level and `#` to match multiple levels. See [topic filter wildcards](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/topic-filter-wildcards) and [identity topic filters guidelines](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/identity-topic-filters-guidelines).

jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction that the configuration applies to. The following options are available: `na` for North America, `eu` for Europe, `jp` for Japan, or `in` for India.

202.description: The configuration has been created or updated. The configuration has been created or updated. Possible warnings about a successful configuration.

errors.title: invalid multi level dynamic topic filter

schema.description: Specifies an error response returned by the IoT Edge Connect API.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem. Consumers should not parse the `detail` member for information; extensions are more suitable and less error-prone ways to obtain such information.
detail.example: There must be at least 8 characters in a password, only 3 were provided.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. This field exists if there are many problems with a single request and you want to call them each out explicitly.

instance.description: The URI for this error occurrence. If a URL, it must be dereferenceable.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server. Used primarily when it may be changed, such as by an intermediary or cache.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: The URI for the error type. If a URL, it must be dereferenceable.

400.description: Validation errors for topic filters, authorization groups, or both.

409.description: The namespace and jurisdiction pair already exists.

get.description: This operation returns configurations across all jurisdictions for the namespace that you specified in the URL.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Edge Connect API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Specifies all configurations associated with the specified namespace.

items.description: The configuration JSON object specifies the configuration associated with the specified namespace and jurisdiction.

acls.description: A list of access control rules for the configuration. Indicates users or clients that can publish or subscribe to specified topics. See [access control lists](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/access-control-lists).

publishers.description: A list of authorization group names. Indicates users or clients that have permission to publish messages to the topic referenced in `topicFilter`. With identity topic filters, use `*` to match a client or user identifier. See [authorization group wildcards](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/authorization-group-wildcard).

subscribers.description: A list of authorization group names. Indicates users or clients that have permission to subscribe to the topic referenced in `topicFilter`. With identity topic filters, use `*` to match a client or user identifier. See [authorization group wildcard](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/authorization-group-wildcard).

topicFilter.description: The path to the topic that you want to authorize `publishers` and `subscribers` to. It is either an absolute path or a wildcarded path. In wildcarded topic filters, use `+` to match a single level and `#` to match multiple levels. See [topic filter wildcards](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/topic-filter-wildcards) and [identity topic filters guidelines](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/identity-topic-filters-guidelines).

jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction to which the configuration applies. The following options are available: `na` for North America, `eu` for Europe, `jp` for Japan, or `in` for India.

namespace.description: The name of the namespace that the configuration applies to.

storage.description: __Read-only__ The amount of storage in megabytes that the namespace can use.

topic-expiry.description: __Read-only__ The number of days for the topic to expire.

200.description: A list of all namespace configurations.

parameters.description: The name of a namespace.
parameters.name: namespace

get.description: This operation returns the configuration for the namespace and jurisdiction that you specified in the URL of the request.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Edge Connect API

acls.description: A list of access control rules for the configuration. Indicates users or clients that can publish or subscribe to specified topics. See [access control lists](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/access-control-lists).

publishers.description: A list of authorization group names. Indicates users or clients that have permission to publish messages to the topic referenced in `topicFilter`. With identity topic filters, use `*` to match a client or user identifier. See [authorization group wildcards](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/authorization-group-wildcard).

subscribers.description: A list of authorization group names. Indicates users or clients that have permission to subscribe to the topic referenced in `topicFilter`. With identity topic filters, use `*` to match a client or user identifier. See [authorization group wildcard](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/authorization-group-wildcard).

topicFilter.description: The path to the topic that you want to authorize `publishers` and `subscribers` to. It is either an absolute path or a wildcarded path. In wildcarded topic filters, use `+` to match a single level and `#` to match multiple levels. See [topic filter wildcards](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/topic-filter-wildcards) and [identity topic filters guidelines](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/identity-topic-filters-guidelines).

namespace.description: The name of the namespace that the configuration applies to.

storage.description: The amount of storage in megabytes that the namespace can use.

topic-expiry.description: The number of days for the topic to expire.

200.description: The namespace in a specified jurisdiction has been found.

schema.description: Specifies an error response returned by the IoT Edge Connect API.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem. Consumers should not parse the `detail` member for information; extensions are more suitable and less error-prone ways to obtain such information.
detail.example: There must be at least 8 characters in a password, only 3 were provided.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. This field exists if there are many problems with a single request and you want to call them each out explicitly.

404.description: The namespace configuration couldn't be found.

put.description: This operation updates the configuration for the namespace and jurisdiction that you specified in the URL of the request. For ACL configuration guidelines, see [access control lists](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/access-control-lists) and [identity topic filters guidelines](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/identity-topic-filters-guidelines).

schema.description: Specifies the existing configuration associated with the specified namespace and jurisdiction.

acls.description: A list of access control rules for the configuration. Indicates users or clients that can publish or subscribe to specified topics. See [access control lists](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/access-control-lists).

publishers.description: A list of authorization group names. Indicates users or clients that have permission to publish messages to the topic referenced in `topicFilter`. With identity topic filters, use `*` to match a client or user identifier. See [authorization group wildcard](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/authorization-group-wildcard).

With identity topic filters, use `*` to match a client or user identifier. See [authorization group wildcard](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/authorization-group-wildcard).

topicFilter.description: The path to the topic that you want to authorize `publishers` and `subscribers` to. It is either an absolute path or a wildcarded path. In wildcarded topic filters, use `+` to match a single level and `#` to match multiple levels. See [topic filter wildcards](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/topic-filter-wildcards) and [identity topic filters guidelines](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iot-edge-connect/reference/identity-topic-filters-guidelines).

parameters.description: __Enum__ The name of a jurisdiction. The following options are available: `na` for North America, `eu` for Europe, `jp` for Japan, or `in` for India.
parameters.name: jurisdiction

parameters.description: The name of a namespace.
parameters.name: namespace

post.description: This operation creates a version of the configuration for the namespace and jurisdiction that you specified in the URL of the request.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Edge Connect API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Specifies the number assigned to the configuration version that you created for the specified namespace and jurisdiction.

version.description: The version of the namespace configuration.

post.summary: Create a version of a namespace configuration

get.description: This operation returns all versions of the configuration for the namespace and jurisdiction that you specified in the URL of the request. It also provides information about the users who created the configuration versions, times when the configuration versions were created, and operation details.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Edge Connect API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Specifies all configuration versions that you activated or deactivated for the specified namespace and jurisdiction.

items.description: The activation JSON object specifies the configuration version that you activated or deactivated for the specified namespace and jurisdiction.

activationStatus.description: The status of the operation specified in `operationType`. The following options are available: `NEW` for an operation that has been created but not initiated, `PENDING` for an operation that is in the process of being performed, `DEPLOYED` for an operation that has successfully been performed, `OBSOLETE` for an operation that has been made obsolete by the validation server, `ABORTED` for an operation request that has been rejected, `FAILED` for an operation request that failed while being processed, or `UNAVAILABLE` for a server error. Try to repeat the last attempted operation for this configuration version or contact your account representative for support.

createdAt.description: A unix epoch timestamp in milliseconds. The most recent timestamp indicates the most recently created configuration version.

createdBy.description: The name of the user who created the configuration version.

jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction where the configuration version was activated or deactivated. The following options are available: `na` for North America, `eu` for Europe, `jp` for Japan, `xw` for the rest of the world, or `in` for India.

namespace.description: The name of the namespace that the configuration version was created for.

operationType.description: The type of the operation performed for the configuration version. The following options are available: `ACTIVATION` for an activation of the configuration version or `DEACTIVATION` for a deactivation of the configuration version, or `N/A` if neither of the operations was performed on the configuration version.

version.description: The version of the namespace configuration.

200.description: A list of all configuration versions.

get.description: This operation returns all activations and deactivations of configuration versions for the namespace and jurisdiction that you specified in the URL of the request. It also provides information about the users who created the configuration versions, times when the configuration versions were created, and operation details.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's IoT Edge Connect API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: Specifies all configuration versions that you activated or deactivated for the specified namespace and jurisdiction.

items.description: The activation JSON object specifies the configuration version that you activated or deactivated for the specified namespace and jurisdiction.

activationStatus.description: The status of the operation specified in `operationType`. The following options are available: `NEW` for an operation that has been created but not initiated, `PENDING` for an operation that is in the process of being performed, `DEPLOYED` for an operation that has successfully been performed, `OBSOLETE` for an operation that has been made obsolete by the validation server, `ABORTED` for an operation request that has been rejected, `FAILED` for an operation request that failed while being processed, or `UNAVAILABLE` for a server error. Try to repeat the last attempted operation for this configuration version or contact your account representative for support.

createdBy.description: The name of the user who created the configuration version.

namespace.description: The name of the namespace that the configuration version was created for.

operationType.description: The type of the operation performed for the configuration version. The following options are available: `ACTIVATION` for an activation of the configuration version or `DEACTIVATION` for a deactivation of the configuration version, or `N/A` if neither of the operations was performed on the configuration version.

schema.description: Specifies an error response returned by the IoT Edge Connect API.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to the problem. Consumers should not parse the `detail` member for information; extensions are more suitable and less error-prone ways to obtain such information.
detail.example: There must be at least 8 characters in a password, only 3 were provided.

errors.description: A list of HTTP problem details. This field exists if there are many problems with a single request and you want to call them each out explicitly.

instance.description: The URI for this error occurrence. If a URL, it must be dereferenceable.

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server. Used primarily when it may be changed, such as by an intermediary or cache.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

type.description: The URI for the error type. If a URL, it must be dereferenceable.
